data.name: Horilka
data.description: Horilka is a Ukrainian alcoholic beverage. The word horilka may also be used in a generic sense in the Ukrainian language to mean vodka or other strong spirits and etymologically is similar to the Ukrainian word for burning - hority.

data.name: Varenyky
data.description: Varenyky are popular Ukrainian dumplings filled with a variety of ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cheese, sauerkraut, eggs, mushrooms, and even fruit.

data.name: Holubtsi
data.description: Holubtsi are traditional Ukrainian cabbage rolls, especially beloved in the Carpathians.

data.name: Chicken Kyiv
data.description: Chicken Kiev is a dish made of chicken fillet pounded and rolled around cold butter, then coated with eggs and bread crumbs, and either fried or baked.

data.name: Com tam
data.description: Rice with pork, eggs, familiar in Vietnam

data.name: Kvass
data.description: Kvass is a traditional fermented Slavic and Baltic beverage commonly made from rye bread.

data.name: Uzvar
data.description: The uzvar is a national Ukrainian beverage, cooked with dried fruits and berries.

data.name: Sugar cane juice
data.description: If you want a sweet drink, go for it!
